text: I have witnessed this in Africa on a micro-level. I have seen land cleared for agriculture with an immediate drying up of once permanent streams, thus illuminating the only water sources for miles. I have witnessed the shortening of the raining season along with the extension and increased severity of the dry season in West Africa. I have seen the desert expand southward as the savanna turns into desert. The longer term consequences will affect us all globally.

text: This video kinda toxic lol I'm a Forestry major and first thing we learn are the differences between controlled forests and "real" forests. The paper you use for your test or the Amazon boxes you receive by mail all come from these controlled forests, those are places you can cut down and manage regularly. These places exist so beautiful places like rainforests can stay untouched. We don't go to Amazon rainforest and cut everything down, turn it into paper. I'm Brazilian and what's destroying our rainforest is mostly cattle and fire (the CO2 problem). Soy is a problem too. The big forestry business are all certificated by FSC, which means you have to follow A BUNCH of rules not to destroy the environment.

text: My response after seeing this video is that I am concerned about the deforestation, because forests play an important role in supporting life on earth. Forests are a source of oxygen that we breathe to survive. There will be many problems that arise if we continue to use the existing forest without replanting it. These problems are like the glass effect that arises from human activities that produce CO2 gas. If deforestation continues, no one absorbs CO2 further, the effect of these greenhouse gases cancels global fires which have an impact on glaciers, drought, forests, causing habitat for these animals to become extinct and causing the ecosystem on earth to become unbalanced.
author: ILMIA MUTMAINAH

text:
Hutan merupakan bagian penting dari kehidupan di bumi,  pada proses kelangsungan kehindupan makhluk hidup. Hutan juga menutupi sebagian dari planet bumi. Berdasarkan data yang diperoleh bahwa sebagian besar hewan, hutan merupakan tempat tinggal hewan dan tumbuhan. Terlebih lagi sebagian besar hewan di dunia hidup di daerah tropis. Tetapi dangan adanya defortasi  berakibat pada jumlah gas rumah kaca di atmosfer. yang dimana semakin sedikit hutan, berarti akan menyebabkan lebih banyak efek rumah kaca memasuki lapisan atmosfer.  terlebih lagi defortasi hutan dapat semakin berkurangnya keanekaragaman hayati.

Dari sini dapat diketahui bahwa dampak utama dari adanya deforestasi adalah terjadinya penurunan kualitas atmosfer. Deforestasi berkontribusi pada pemanasan global yang terjadi karena adanya peningkatan konsentrasi gas rumah kaca (greenhouse gases) yang menyebabkan kenaikan suhu udara global.

text:
Hutan sangat berperan penting bagi kehidupan makhluk hidup. Seperti yang telah dikatakan dalam video tersebut, bahwa hutan adalah habitat atau tempat tinggal bagi 80% tumbuhan dan hewan . Penggundulan hutan dapat menimbulkan efek yang sangat luar biasa. Efek yang akibatkan penggundulan hutan yaitu emisi gas rumah kaca yang menyebabkan efek rumah kaca. Seperti yang kita ketahui, efek rumah kaca berkaitan erat dengan pemanasan global. Oleh karena itu, pemanasan global akan semakin bertambah tiap tahunnya. Selain itu, efek sampingnyalagi adalah kepunahan. Sekitar 4 sampai 6 ribu spesies telah punah akibat penggundulan hutan. Sehingga keanekaragaman hayati dalam hutan tidaklah seimbang. 

Forests are very important for the life of living things. As has been said in the video, that the forest is a place to live for 80% of plants and animals. Deforestation can have biggest effects. The effect from deforestation is the emission of greenhouse gases which causes the greenhouse effect. As we know, the greenhouse effect is closely related to global warming. Therefore, global warming will increase every year. Besides, another side effect is extinction. About 4 to 6 thousand species have become extinct due to deforestation. So that the biodiversity in the forest is not balanced.
author: Shafira Putri Andini

text: What this video mentions only briefly is how not all forestry and logging activities lead to deforestation. Deforestation occurs when the land is converted from forest land into another landuse. This is primarily happening in second and third world where they lack other opportunities for national income such as manufacturing, tech, etc. So land is cleared and converted into other uses such as cattle or plantations. Modern forestry in developed countries is based on 100+ years of science and experience to ensure that we will have forests in perpetuity. There are third party certifications that allow you to see that the wood based products you are purchasing are sourced sustainably. Sustainable Forestry Initiative (SFI) and Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) are two of the prominent ones. So next time you see a clearcut, don't just assume that it will never grow trees again, it is more then likely that it will be replanted to grow trees for the next generation.

text: It is also worth noting that if a tree is cut and manufactured into a long lasting product, such as lumber, plywood, etc, that the carbon contained in that product is sequestered from the atmosphere. Then if a tree is planted in the first trees place, that tree will begin using carbon from the atmosphere to grow, all while the first tree's carbon is still being stored in the long lasting product. This means that a properly managed working forest can actually be a carbon sink rather than a source.

text:
This video is a bit misleading. There are more trees on the planet now than there were in 1800. It turns out that it's actually in lumber companies' and governments' interest to keep their natural resources secure (who knew?), so they plant several trees for each they topple.

The real issue is habitat destruction. Yes, new trees are being planted, but old growth forests provide critical habitat for species, and felling these habitats endangers them. The issue isn't CO2.

text:
You cannot compare just the number of trees. A tropical forest is an ecosystem where clouds are created from evaporating water vapors from trees which then condense into rains that rejuvenate the forest. Those cloud covers created by rainforests help reflect heat from the sun which otherwise will be absorbed by the ground. Anybody familiar with tropical rainforests knows that it is much cooler under the forest canopy than when outside. Plantations created from vast tracts of rainforest cannot replicate these cycle of evaporations and condensations, hence deforestation of any form is destructive to this eco-system. 
You are correct that it is in the interest of logging companies to protect forest resources. The problem is short-sighted governments that see large logging companies as enemies of the forest. Well-organized logging companies are usually committed to reforestation and protecting the forest. But they cannot do that when governments cancel their logging license, which usually results in the demise of logging companies. Logging accesses are in most cases treated as private roads maintained and secured by logging companies. When the logging companies are gone, the roads are now wide open to illegal loggers, slash and burn farmers, charcoal makers and other characters who do not really care about government regulations or maintaining the forest. The result is massive deforestation.
The main engine in the rapid deforestation of tropical forest is the uncontrolled growth of the human population. And what is fueling the rapid growth in human population, especially in tropical countries, is another story.
